parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>0.50

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Unit Inventory

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Vehicle Inventory

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Sets how much ammunition (compared to the configuration of magazines defined in the vehicle's class) the vehicle has. Note that the ammo will only be added to [[local]] turrets. To check the locality of turret use [[turretLocal]].

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> unit '''setVehicleAmmoDef''' value

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unit: [[Object]] - Unit or vehicle.

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> value: [[Number]] - From 0 (no ammo) to 1 (fully loaded).

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[player]] [[setVehicleAmmoDef]] 0;</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[setVehicleAmmo]], [[ammo]], [[setAmmo]], [[setAmmoCargo]], [[turretLocal]]
</value></part></template>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on December 20, 2014 - 21:49 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Actium|Actium]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
For vehicles this command operates relative to its stock magazine loadout (i.e. its CfgVehicles magazines[] values). Thus ''setVehicleAmmoDef 1'' will fully restore a vehicle to its default ammunition capacity, resetting any changes made by intentionally/implicitly adding/removing magazines.
Use [[setVehicleAmmo]] to operate in relation to a vehicle's current magazine loadout.
--[[User:Actium|Actium]] ([[User talk:Actium|talk]]) 22:49, 20 December 2014 (CET)
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
